reviews.review_msg: Patrick has taught me three times now at Saint Marys and he is hands down one of the best teachers at SMU. You can tell that he is very passionate about his work and the puts in the work to help his student. Ive taken his 1st, 3rd and 4th year courses and Ive gotten A+ for all and its because of his teaching style and love for the field.

He taught in Langara spring 2017, it is his first time teaching here, he is very enthusiastic and smart. However, his exams were really tough, class average was low. Chill class with weekly quizzes. The exam are based off of his lecture and mostly from the textbook, so read!
Patrick is super passionate but the topic is very dry. Be prepared to read the text. He gives pretty good study guides that are quite helpful. Don't take this if you're not into Cog Psyc.
He is good by nature
His lectures are filled with info so attend them and study for quizzes.

Patrick is awesome! The course isn't an easy A though. Put in the work and know your material well. Lectures are actually pretty interesting and he gives really fun examples of different concepts. He let us know the written questions for the final exam so we could prepare. Wish he taught other courses I could take! Also, he's incredibly cute.

Gives really great lectures and keeps you engaged. Readings are pretty heavy (about 20 pages/chapter), which is why there are 4 exams compared to one midterm and final. He posts lecture recordings online, so if you don't go to class, make sure to catch up as they are very useful! Not a GPA booster -- you've got to put in the work!

An awesome prof!  He has the right combination of assertiveness and firmness, but is also very caring, fair, and compassionate toward his students.  Attend class (lecture material is tested), read, and you'll do fine.  He's also hilarious and engaging - and the lectures are worth listening to.  Definitely recommend taking this class with him.

Extremely engaging lectures (especially considering the somewhat dry material) and fair exams (no surprises at all). Honestly one of my favorite profs at SFU, he clearly enjoys what he teaches and has a great sense of humor.

He is young but clearly loves what he teaches. I took this class as a major requirement but I had no interest in PSYC. He actually made it interesting and enjoyable. Read the textbook, go to the lectures, and you will do great.
He makes his lectures interesting, but his written questions on exams are extremely tough and specific.

If you're a 1st year, take his PSYC100 course. He is so thorough and specific that it'll really help you feel more comfortable with being in university. Although if you're in any year after your first, it can get a bit annoying because sometimes he takes so long. He has really clear criteria. I definitely recommend this class. Also he's a cutie.
Super hilarious and dorky guy. He's young so he makes an effort to use pop culture references. Lectures are easy to understand, and the readings are interesting! He's also super cute.

Lecture material differs from that in the textbook, but audio & slides are posted on Canvas. Quizzes and tests are quite straightforward and if you've taken notes and read the textbook, you will be fine. A lot of test questions are pulled from LaunchPad practice tests and Learning Curves, so I highly recommend using it to study.
Super nice guy and pretty good looking

He's super nice and friendly, and totally understands the fact that everyone has a life outside of school and may fall behind in some things. All in all, super cool guy, 10/10 would recommend, plus he's super cute!

To do well in this class, make good notes, ask him questions, and visit your TA's. Stay consistent with the readings, read each lecture slide thoroughly, he likes to issue short answer questions on the smallest of details. For the final read the assigned article, he likes to give short answer questions on that. It is a lengthy read.

Very fun and energetic instructor. Lectures are okay but I think that is the nature of the material. PSYC 325 is heavy with behavorism so if you don't like it it can get very dry sometimes. Kudos to Patrick for jokes and trying to make the dry materials easy to understand. Very easy to talk to.

I LOVED this class. I think Patrick is hilarious, absolutely loved his Starcraft and Pokemon analogy. I found his exams to be super straightforward. If you attend his classes and take really good notes, this class is not hard at all. I honestly don't why people are complaining about him, I thought his teaching style was very clear!

Patrick is a really nice and funny guy. If you keep up with the readings, attend class, and ask him questions when you are confused, you should get a good grade. The tests are a bit tricky though so make sure you know the material well.
Thinks too highly of his teaching ability; places too much emphasis on attendance than conveying information in a fair manner.

He's a young, probably haven't taught a class for a long time (lack of teaching reviews), but he clearly knows what's he's doing.  Attend lecures regularly to avoid missing the iclicker quiz or group discussion (-1% per missing the session). Hard marker (64% D). You better prepared to study real hard to pass or don't take it.

Patrick is an awesome teacher:) Although he is young, may be he needs more practical experience in teaching, but you can feel that he tries his best to make everything more clearer. Moreover, Patrick is accessible for help and very patient, if you have questions, don't hesitate to ask him. Readings are mandatory!!!!please rate your textbook.
Terrible class.
